pub_date: 2025-10-03  ICT interest and self-concept as determinants of Swiss adolescents’ vocational choices  Empirical Research in Vocational Education and Training
title: This study, conducted in collaboration with TREE, examines the extent to which ICT interest and ICT self-concepts influence the career choices of young Swiss people. It reveals strong gender-specific differences with important implications for the debate on the shortage of skilled workers and women in the ICT sector. Röhlke, Leo; Herzing, Jessica; Gomensoro, Andrés; Krebs-Oesch, Dominique (2025). ICT interest and self-concept as determinants of Swiss adolescents’ vocational choices. Empirical Research in Vocational Education and Training, 17: 24. paper-title-number-1
